Operation 'CreateFieldDefinition' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The current description is comprehensive but lacks clarity on the return value structure and explicit statement of what the operation accomplishes. Added explicit mention of the returned object structure and consolidated the warning about number-prefixed fields for better AI agent understanding of the operation's effects and outputs.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint creates a new custom field definition.**

Custom field definitions are created with the given `name` and `field_type`. Although field names are stored in a case-sensitive manner, all field names must be case-insensitively unique. This means you may create a field named `CamelCase` or `camelcase`, but not both. Additionally, a Custom Field name cannot collide with any Reserved Field names. You should save the returned `id` value in order to update or delete the field at a later date. You can have up to 500 custom fields.

The custom field name should be created using only alphanumeric characters (A-Z and 0-9) and underscores (_). Custom fields can only begin with letters A-Z or underscores (_). The field type can be date, text, or number fields. The field type is important for creating segments from your contact database.

**Note: Creating a custom field that begins with a number will cause issues with sending in Marketing Campaigns.**
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new custom field definition with the specified name and field type. Custom field names must be case-insensitively unique and cannot collide with Reserved Field names. Names must contain only alphanumeric characters (A-Z, 0-9) and underscores (_), and must begin with a letter or underscore (not a number). Supported field types are: date, text, or number. Field type determines segment creation capabilities. Returns the created custom field definition object with an `id` value that should be saved for future updates or deletions. Up to 500 custom fields can be created per account. Note: Custom fields beginning with numbers may cause issues with Marketing Campaigns sending.
data.reasoning: The current description is comprehensive but lacks clarity on the return value structure and explicit statement of what the operation accomplishes. Added explicit mention of the returned object structure and consolidated the warning about number-prefixed fields for better AI agent understanding of the operation's effects and outputs.

data.current_description: **This endpoint retrieves all defined Custom Fields and Reserved Fields.**
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve all custom and reserved field definitions
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a complete list of all custom field definitions and reserved field definitions for your account. Returns an array containing both custom fields you have created and system-reserved fields. This operation is useful for understanding available fields for contact segmentation and data management. No parameters are required.
data.reasoning: Original summary and description are too minimal. Enhanced summary to be more specific about what is retrieved. Expanded description to clarify that both custom and reserved fields are returned, explain the use case for retrieving this list, and confirm no parameters are needed for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'UpdateFieldDefinition' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Current description is too brief and lacks critical details about inputs, outputs, and update behavior. Added explicit mention of the path parameter requirement, clarification that partial updates are supported, indication of what can be updated, return value specification, and error handling for reserved fields to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update a defined Custom Field.**

Only your Custom fields can be modified; Reserved Fields cannot be updated.
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing custom field definition identified by the custom_field_id path parameter. Only custom fields can be modified; reserved fields cannot be updated. Supports partial updates - only provided fields will be modified. Common updatable properties include the field name and other configuration settings. Returns the updated custom field definition object. Attempting to update a reserved field will result in an error.
data.reasoning: Current description is too brief and lacks critical details about inputs, outputs, and update behavior. Added explicit mention of the path parameter requirement, clarification that partial updates are supported, indication of what can be updated, return value specification, and error handling for reserved fields to improve AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'DeleteFieldDefinition' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Current description lacks essential details about the operation's destructive nature and side effects. Added explicit mention of the path parameter, clarification of permanent deletion consequences, explanation that associated contact data will be removed, error handling for reserved fields, and specification of the success response to help AI agents understand the full impact of this operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint deletes a defined Custom Field.**

You can delete only Custom Fields; Reserved Fields cannot be deleted.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a custom field definition identified by the custom_field_id path parameter. Only custom fields can be deleted; reserved fields cannot be deleted and will result in an error if deletion is attempted. Deletion is permanent and will remove the field definition from your account. Any contact data previously stored in this custom field will be removed. Attempting to delete a reserved field will return an error. Returns a success response with no content on successful deletion.
data.reasoning: Current description lacks essential details about the operation's destructive nature and side effects. Added explicit mention of the path parameter, clarification of permanent deletion consequences, explanation that associated contact data will be removed, error handling for reserved fields, and specification of the success response to help AI agents understand the full impact of this operation.
